item.title: Open reach left a messy/patchy footpath, 20th August
item.description:
Uneven surface and dusty, messy pavement outside people’s front doors. Open reach communications came to do work without prior notice and then left pavement like that. When asked if they were going to put it the same way it was I was told to contact the council. The pavement looks terrible, it’s uneven and together with all the unkept gardens on the street and weeds is an eyesore and tripping hazard!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Founders Gardens, Upper Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rosenthorpe Road, Nunhead, London

item.title: Litter and leaves, 20th August
item.description:
Whole north side of Dorset square needs street cleaning. This is a recurring problem. There does not appear to be an adequate street sweeping service on the north side. The south side is often immaculate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dorset Square, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree too tall and swaying dangerously, 20th August
item.description:
Tree on Downs Avenue outside number 24 has been allowed to grow very tall. When it’s windy it’s swaying and is a cause for concern. It needs pruning to a much safer height.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downs Avenue, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over hanging blackberry bush, 20th August
item.description:
On the side of rectory place there is a house 68 St mary street with over hanging blackberry bush it is hanging on to the pathway and over the fence I've cut my on the ones over hanging this is not on as it is very dangerous as people have to walk by this

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Place, London

item.title: On the green on left and right of Quantock Road, 20th August
item.description:
Lady who drives ford Fiesta reg EJ19 YHP has 3 large dogs (2 alsatians and 1 husky) who on a daily basis lets them all go to the toilet and not once does she attempt to pick it up. She also brushes them occasionally at the same area leaving all the hair behind to blow into peoples garden and drives. She is not a responsible dog owner and residents have now had enough.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Quantock Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin needs empting again, 20th August
item.description:
Why every 2 weeks I have to report this. The bin needs to be changed every week. the rubbish on the floor is now coming into my drive its disgusting, please can it be removed if not maintained by the council .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet
